title: Ticket #1784: Newer hard disks may exceed MAX_INT in available size
description:
With modern hard drives and their increasing sizes, we may no longer be able to fit the kB value into integer space. As reported in the mentioned rust ticket, this leads (maybe among other things) to an annoying repeat of the error message 

sysapi_disk_space_raw: Free disk space kbytes overflow, capping
to INT_MAX

in the StartLog.

Suggestion for a plan of action:

  • Revisiting of behavior if disk space available exceeds MAX_INT: Are there other possible problems?
  • Dealing differently with those error messages - sticking to one per start-up, rather than repeating it very frequently
remarks:
2010-Nov-23 09:32:13 by matt:
We should seriously consider introduction of units into the attribute name, providing DiskSizeMB and DiskSizeGB. The underlying APIs would have to support it, and GregT showed that ClassAds themselves may need modification to support >32bit integral values.
2011-Jan-27 14:50:47 by danb:
Bulk change of target version from v070505 to v070506 using ./ticket-target-mover.
2011-Feb-01 16:20:02 by tannenba:
Bulk change of target version from v070506 to NULL using ./ticket-target-mover.

2011-Dec-12 16:32:03 by pfc:
On 12-core systems with 24 slots, this fills the StartLog with thousands of lines of garbage... at 24 lines every 5 minutes, we see >100k lines per month of just this message. :-p

The "real" fix (different units or 64-bit values) is not urgent and not worth spending lots of time on yet -- but if there's a ten-minute fix (like printing this message once at startup and not again) could you consider it for an upcoming release?

Thanks.

2013-Aug-27 10:56:56 by johnkn:
The 8.1.x series has ClassAds can store 64 bit values, and a wire protocol that will transfer 64 bit ints, so we can now finally get rid of the truncation of disk space and just put a 64 bit value in the Disk attribute.

2013-Aug-28 14:15:21 by gthain:
CODE REVIEW

All changes look code. Let's double check to see if the call in the old shadow is really needed, and remove the psuedo op if that function is truly dead code.

Also, do we really need the #ifdef STDC and pre-ansi C declaration? If not, let's get rid of that also.

2013-Sep-24 10:44:14 by smoler:
Ticket placed back into the docpending state, as we need to document this change in the manual. At the very least, a version history item is needed.
